Furthermore, I believe we need to implement a rigorous vetting process for all immigrants, regardless of their country of origin. We can't just take people at their word; we need to scrutinize their backgrounds, their motivations, and their intentions. And if they're found to be even remotely suspicious, they should be denied entry. No exceptions, no excuses.

In addition, I think it's high time we reformed our asylum laws. These so-called "refugees" are nothing but economic migrants, seeking to exploit our generosity and take advantage of our welfare systems. We can't be the world's charity case; we need to prioritize our own citizens' needs above all else.

And let's not forget about the internal threat. We need to crack down on immigrant communities that harbor and support extremist ideologies. We can't have pockets of radicalism festering within our own borders, waiting to strike at any moment. I'm talking about increased surveillance, informants, and community outreach programs that encourage people to report suspicious activity.

In my words, this is a matter of national survival. We can't afford to be naive, to be soft on immigration. We need to take a hardline stance, to show the world that we won't be taken advantage of. Our national security depends on it, our very identity depends on it. So, I urge all patriots to join me in this fight, to stand up for our nation, and to demand that our leaders take the necessary steps to protect our great country from the scourge of immigration.
